summary: An email from April 25, 2008, reporting that Jeffrey Epstein's private investigator, Robert Myers, attempted to contact and threaten a victim, and providing an update on Epstein's travel to Israel and his public relations efforts regarding his legal case.

events.title: Epstein's travel to Israel
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Israel for Passover, reportedly to meet with Israeli scientists about medical research and tour military bases with Benny Shabtal, while his legal case was ongoing in the U.S.

events.title: Private investigator threatens victim
events.description: Epstein's private investigator, Robert Myers, tracked down a victim, told her if she wouldn't talk to him her name would appear in the press, and suggested she consider how that would affect her.

locations: Tel Aviv Hilton, Tel Aviv, Israel
keyFacts: Epstein's private investigator, Robert Myers, attempted to contact a victim and threatened that her name would appear in the press if she did not cooperate.
The victim was provided with a pro bono lawyer and informed of her right to contact police if she felt threatened or harassed.
Jeffrey Epstein was in Israel for Passover in April 2008, reportedly meeting with scientists and touring military bases, while facing U.S. charges for soliciting prostitution involving minors.
A representative for Epstein claimed the alleged victims had all acknowledged lying about their age, as part of his public defense.
The correspondence includes a press update suggesting Epstein was avoiding the U.S. temporarily due to his legal troubles.
